intro: Calea jelskii, commonly known as the velvetleaf calea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in humid, well-drained soils. Calea jelskii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
